column4: Hello. I’ve tried to make a boot USB flash drive with Ubuntu Lucid (the last LTS) 32 bits. When I try to boot on the USB flash drive, on two different computers, I get the message “vesamenu.c32: not a COM32R image”. Is that a deficiency of the flash drive which I should replace or did I forget something important?
how did you load the usb?
never have seen that error, hope that works.
